title: o tawa kepeken nasin Lapan!  | o tawa kepeken nasin Lapan!
description: Practice your Toki Pona listening skills, learn about Laban Movement Analysis, and move around in a bunch of fun ways! This will be a toki pona taso lesson on a few basic ideas from Laban Movement Analysis, a system for describing human movement used in dance, theatre, voice acting, and more—and a chance to move around and be a little silly during the livestream.

title: Mappo | o musi Mapo!
description: Social deduction game, played in toki pona. Figure out who the werewolves are, and exile them before they kill you!

title: How to Use Jargons in Toki Pona? nasin Lapan and more | toki pi nasin ante lon toki pona? nasin Lapan en sin
description: Scientific, political, and similar sets of terminology are know to be a weak spot for Toki Pona, but is there a way to effectively use (at leas some) jargons in Toki Pona while still staying true to the language? In this conversational discussion, I’ll share some of the principles I used to translate the terminology of Laban Movement Analysis into Toki Pona, how these might apply more broadly, and the possible benefits of using Toki Pona in these situations. This will also serve as an English-language Q&A for those coming from o tawa kepeken nasin Lapan!

title: Salvage the Spinach Bed: No-weeding garden technique! | nasin pali: o kipisi e kasi, o kama e kili!
description: Maybe you’ve heard of no-dig gardening… now, try no weeding! This video will show you how to salvage a runaway vege garden with some shears and sheer willpower, all in Toki Pona.

description: once, kulupu pi toki musi was a flourishing youtube channel, but one day it disappeared into oblivion… now, it has returned! what’s up?
